New Records: Mitchell Marsh scored the second-highest individual score of this World Cup after Glenn Maxwell's 201*.
Adam Zampa moved to the top of the charts in this World Cup with 22 wickets, one more than Dilshan Madushanka.
Bangladesh posted their highest total in this World Cup in their last game.
Mitchell Marsh finished unbeaten on 177 off 132 balls, his highest ODI score, and also the second-highest in the World Cup.
Key Match Events: Mitchell Marsh smashed the bowlers all over the park, hitting 17 fours and nine sixes.
Taskin Ahmed had Travis Head early, but after that Mitchell Marsh put on two massive stands with David Warner and Steven Smith to take Australia home.
Marnus Labuschagne did a Jonty Rhodes to send Mahmudullah back.
Mahmudullah has been Bangladesh's leading run-scorer in this World Cup and he continues his good form today, hitting two maximums off Mitchell Marsh.
Adam Zampa claimed his 21st wicket of the tournament, making him the joint-highest wicket-taker along with Sri Lanka's Dilshan Madushanka.
Sean Abbott gave Bangladesh the breakthrough with his first wicket in this World Cup, dismissing Tanzid Hasan.
Litton Das and Tanzid Hasan gave Bangladesh a good start, finishing the powerplay with Bangladesh at 62 for no loss.
Pre-Game Insights: Pat Cummins had bowled 12 overs in the first powerplay in this World Cup, coming into this game, and is yet to pick up a wicket in the phase.
Australia have won all of their three matches against Bangladesh in ODI World Cups, and will look to extend that streak.
Bangladesh have made two changes, with Nasum Ahmed, Mahedi Hasan and Mustafizur Rahman coming into the team.
Steven Smith is back, but it's for Glenn Maxwell, while Sean Abbott comes in for Mitchell Starc.
Post-Match Reflections: Australia will now shift their focus to South Africa and the Eden Gardens.
For Bangladesh, the defeat marks the end of a dour campaign, but at least they have ensured they get to the Champions Trophy.
Mitchell Marsh has cramped up a couple of times now while batting and is not looking at his most comfortable, even as he goes past is previous highest score in the format.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Bangladesh's top seven all crossed the 20-run mark.
Adam Zampa zooms to the top of the wicket-takers' charts in this World Cup with 22, one more than Dilshan Madushanka.
Bangladesh have put in a team effort with the bat, with only one half-centurion, but plenty of other significant contributions from the rest as well.
Australia's chase of 291 against Afghanistan in their last game was their biggest in World Cups, but today they made short work of the 307-run target set by Bangladesh.
Others: Mitchell Marsh has been devastating as an opener, but his returns at No. 3 haven't quite been similar and he will want to play a big knock today.
Mehidy Hasan Miraz provided the push at the death to give Bangladesh their first 300-plus total of the tournament, finishing on 29 off 20.
Mitchell Marsh shimmies down the track to hit Nasum Ahmed for his second six of the game, reaching 30, which is his average at No. 3 in this World Cup.
